title.narrative: African Forest Forum , 2016-2019, Strengthening Sustst. Forest Mang´t in Africa
African Forest Forum, 2016-2019, Strengthening Sust. Forest Mang´t in Africa

description.narrative:
African Forest Forum has applied to Sida for funding of 48 million SEK to carry out the project on 'Strengthening Sustainable Forest Management in Africa' during the period 2014-2019.
The intervention aims to generate and share knowledge and information through partnerships in ways that provide inputs into policy options and capacity building for improved forest management that better address poverty eradication and environmental protection in Africa. This will be through i) facilitation of the emergence of a strong partnership platform through which stakeholders will identify challenges related to sustainable management of forest and tree resources and create solutions; ii) facilitating the collation, synthesis, provision of access to critical information and knowledge demanded by stakeholders; iii) catalyse efforts to enhance sustainable management practices that have potential to improve resilience of forest to adverse effects of climate change; iv) facilitiating the formulation and harmonisation of evidence-based policies, regulations and governance mechanisms to strengthen public and private institutions to effectively support sustainable forest management; enhancing the capacity of institutions and individuals including farmers organisations, private sector actors, proffessional organisations and public sector to achieve forest compatible development and v) stengthening participation of African countries in regional and international forestry and climate change discources.
The intervention total's budget is 48 million SEK all of which will be contributed by Sida.

Insatsen syftar till att skapa och dela kunskap och information genom partnerskapssamarbeten på sätt som tillhandahåller input om policyalternativ och kapacitetsbyggnad för en förbättrad skogshantering, vilken på ett bättre sätt verkar för fattigdomsbekämpning och miljöskydd i Afrika. Detta kommer att ske genom i) underlättande av skapandet av en stark partnerskapsplattform, genom vilken intressenter kommer att kunna identifiera utmaningar relaterade till en hållbar hantering av skogs- och träresurser och skapa lösningar; ii) underlättande av jämförelse, syntes och tillhandahållande av åtkomst till kritisk information och kunskap som efterfrågas av intressenter; iii) katalyserande av ansträngningar för att förbättra hållbara hanteringsmetoder med potential att förbättra skogens motståndskraft mot olika effekter av klimatförändringar; underlätta utformningen och harmoniseringen av evidensbaserade policies, förordningar och styrningsmekanismer i syfte att stärka offentliga och privata organisationers arbete för att effektivt stödja hållbar skogshantering; underlättande av organisationers och privatpersoners kapacitet, inklusive bondeorganisationer, aktörer inom den privata sektorn, yrkesorganisationer och den offentliga sektorn, i syfte att uppnå en kompatibel skogsutveckling och v) stärkande av afrikanska länders deltagande i regionala och interregionala skogs- och klimatförändringsdiskurser.
Insatsens totala budget uppgår till 48 miljoner SEK, vilken finansieras och hållet av Sida.

To generate and share knowledge and information through partnerships in ways that provide inputs into policy options and capacity building for improved forest management that better address poverty eradication and environmental protection in Africa.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The intervention named ``Strengthning Sustainable Forest Management in Africa`` is primarily aimed at generating and sharing of high quality, up-to-date information and to exploring collaborative opportunities related to African forests, in order to support making evidence-based decisions, as well as updating stakeholders on developments in the forestry and related sectors. The objective was to be achieved through the implementation of six project components, each addressing some critical issues of a corresponding inter-related objectives. The six components of the intervention were: Partnership platform for catalyzed institutional change, Knowledge management and brokerage for enhanced management of forest resources in Africa, Forest and tree resources management for enhanced human livelihoods, Forest policy, regulation, governance and trade in forest and tree products, Strengthening Africa’s capacity for sustainable management and use of forest and tree resources and Supporting Africa’s engagement in global and regional forestry processes and implementation of agreements. In addressing these six components and their objectives, the cooperation partner sought to influence and facilitate organisations (governmental and non-governmental) and individual stakeholders to take actions that would lead to sustainable forest management in ways that would eventually enhance livelihoods and environmental stability - critical prerequisites for eradicating poverty. Accordingly, the intervention implemented by the African Forest Forum (AFF) during the period April 2014 to July 2019, has significantly contributed to: Establishment of institutional platforms for catalyzing innovation in African forestry Generation of declarations and/or resolutions through consensus building among key players in forestry. Improved access to information and knowledge required to strengthen the management of African forest and tree resources, Explored opportunities to enhance the contribution of forests and tree resources to livelihoods and environmental sustainability, Improved the capacities of institutions that support forestry, Enhanced quality engagement of stakeholders on forestry issues, Contributed to the development of improved forestry and related policies and practices at international, continental and regional level, Increased access to the knowledge and information generated by the contribution has enhanced stakeholders’ awareness on the contribution of forest resources, and actions that need to be taken to achieve sustainable forest management, leading to achievement of various project outcomes, Through execution of the project components the intervention has made significant contributions to implementation of forestry programmes of Regional Economic Commissions in Africa (ECOWAS, ECCAS, EAC, SADC).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
